titlestmt.titleproper: Joseph Jeffries Wilson papers, Inclusive: 1915-1961, undated, Bulk: 1934-1961

note.p: Â© 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The Joseph Jeffries Wilson papers contain personal, family, and A.J. Moore High School materials generated by Professor J.J. Wilson in his 37 years of working as principle at the school.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Joseph Jeffries Wilson, or J.J. Wilson (1905-1989), was born on 1905 August 27 to parents Bertrust T. Wilson Sr. (1868-1934) and Harriet Jeffries Bailey Wilson (1868-1953) in Waco, Texas. Bertrust Wilson, who had received a master's degree in mathematics at age nineteen, had been a professor at Guadalupe College and Central Texas College before becoming principal at A.J. Moore High School in Waco.

J.J. Wilson's early education included attending A.J. Moore High School in Waco, obtaining a Bachelor of Arts degree from Bishop College in Marshall, Texas, and a Master of Arts degree from Kansas University. He received a doctoral degree in 1954 from Paul Quinn College. He also helped his brother with a family business, the Wilson Rug Laundry. Wilson also married Margaret H. Wilson (1908-2009). The couple had one daughter, Kathy Wilson Goss.

In 1934, Wilson's father passed away while still in charge of A.J. Moore High School, leading to J.J. Wilson becoming the next principal of A.J. Moore. For the next thirty-seven years, he led A.J. Moore High School to academic success, with many high school students finding that their schooling at A.J. Moore prepared them well for life and further academic pursuits.
In 1971, with the closing of A.J. Moore High School, Wilson became assistant superintendent for secondary schools in Waco. It is unknown how long he held this position.

Professor J.J. Wilson passed away on 1989 October 6 and is buried in Doris Miller Memorial Park in Waco, Texas. Margaret Wilson lived on until passing on 2009 October 5. She is also buried in Doris Miller Memorial Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Joseph Jeffries Wilson papers contain personal and family materials, plus materials relating to A.J. Moore High School. The personal series includes correspondence, mostly about financial matters. The family series also contains mostly financial documents, including bank statements, legal documents, and tax forms. The Moore High School series includes correspondence and school board minutes regarding equal pay for African American teachers, Wilson's yearly teaching contracts, and several letters regarding financial operations of the school.

Joseph Jeffries Wilson went by a variety of names throughout his life. Commonly referred to J.J. Wilson in correspondence, at some point in his academic career, he became known as Professor J.J. Wilson, though he never taught on the university level. His students at A.J. Moore seem to have referred to him as Professor J.J. Wilson. He is also occasionally referred to as Dr. J.J. Wilson, probably after he received a doctorate from Paul Quinn College.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Joseph Jeffries Wilson papers were arranged in several folders and a binder prior to processing.
Currently, the Joseph Jeffries Wilson papers are arranged in three series: I. Personal, II. Family, III. A.J. Moore High School.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph Jeffries Wilson papers, Accession #575, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Paul T. Fisher. Released on 2020-02-21.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains correspondence, financial, and legal documents to do with J.J. Wilson or his family. This series is in good condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains resources related to Joseph Jeffries Wilson's extended family, especially financial matters related to his mother after his father had already passed away. This series is in average condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains information relating to A.J. Moore High School, where Professor J.J. Wilson served as principal for thirty-seven years. This series is in good condition.
